replies.bodyText: This seems like a mistake.  What should this be?
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText:
I was trying to scope it down to the minimum - so that the application that does not require MSGraph does not have to request preauthorization for the other 2 - which is optional in the form.
Maybe it's not a good idea and we should keep the same pattern throughout the code (that our minimum = getDelimitedDefaultScopeString())
replies.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: Can we send the customary offline_access openid profile and not specify a resource? Seems preferable, as MS Graph doesn't exist in all clouds
replies.author: iambmelt

replies.bodyText:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-permissions-and-consent#openid-connect-scopes
The Microsoft identity platform implementation of OpenID Connect has a few well-defined scopes that are also hosted on the Microsoft Graph: openid, email, profile, and offline_access. The address and phone OpenID Connect scopes are not supported.
This describes why I was hitting the MSgraph preauthorized error with those scopes (AADSTS65002: Consent between first party application '[CLIENT_ID]' and first party resource '00000003-0000-0000-c000-000000000000' must be configured via preauthorization. Visit https://identitydocs.azurewebsites.net/static/aad/preauthorization.html).
